&lt;strong&gt;@@PRODUCT_NAME@@&lt;/stron: <strong>@@PRODUCT_NAME@@</strong> is an open source (GPLv2) Linux systems management solution. Below are some links that should prove useful if you have any questions regarding your @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ server.

&lt;strong&gt;NOTE:&lt;/strong&gt; IPMI: <strong>NOTE:</strong> IPMI is the only power management type that has been tested and is supported, but others may work. To enable other power management types override the 'java.power_management.types' option in rhn.conf.
The hostname or IP address of the power: The hostname or IP address of the power management server.
The username used to log in to the power: The username used to log in to the power management server.
The password used to log in to the power: The password used to log in to the power management server.
The identifier used to specify this syst: The identifier used to specify this system on the power management server. Optional because not all power managment types will need this field. This field can also be used to pass additional options to the 'fence agent'. For example, if you are using an IPMI server that requires the Lanplus protocol (and this system's identifier was 'System') then you can set a System Identifier of '-P System' to instruct fence_ipmilan to use the Lanplus protocol for this system. See the fence agent's documentation for additional options.
&lt;strong&gt;SECURITY WARNING:&lt;/stro: <strong>SECURITY WARNING:</strong> Information saved on this page is available to anyone on the network. &lt;p&gt;In case the kickstart scenario: <p>In case the kickstart scenario contains any shell script using variables like <code>$(example)</code> its content should be escaped by using the backslash symbol:</p> <pre>This is an $(example) content.</pre> <p>If variable named <em>"example"</em> is defined in the kickstart snippet, the templating engine will evaluate <code>"$example"</code> with its content. If there is no such variable, the content will be left unchanged. Escaping the <code>$</code> symbol will prevent the templating engine to perform its evaluation as an internal variable.</p> <p>Long scripts or strings can be escaped by wrapping them with the <code>#raw</code> and <code>#end raw</code> directives. @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ allows administrators t: @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ allows administrators to efficiently manage the systems on their network. Through a simple user interface, administrators can perform patch management, updates, monitoring, and maintenance. And because @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ is Web-based, it can be accessed from anywhere. @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ or Proxy server options provide advanced capabilities and the ability to get updates directly from Red Hat with even greater levels of security and reduced network bandwidth.
@@PRODUCT_NAME@@ currently offers three: @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ currently offers three modules. Customers can purchase entitlements that allow their systems to be subscribed to the modules and receive @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ services and functionality. <a href='http://www.redhat.com/software/rhn/purchase/' target='_blank'>Learn more</a>.
Complimentary with a subscription to RHE: Complimentary with a subscription to RHEL, the Update Module allows you to easily install new updates to your system, receive priority errata notifications, ensure RPM dependency checking, and <a href='http://www.redhat.com/rhn/rhndetails/update/' target='_blank'>more</a>.
The Management Module, which includes al: The Management Module, which includes all the functionality of the Update Module, also gives you the ability to group your systems for easier maintenance, assign role-based permissions, schedule update actions, develop custom content channels (in conjunction with @@PRODUCT_NAME@@), and <a href='http://www.redhat.com/rhn/rhndetails/management/' target='_blank'>more</a>.
The Provisioning Module, which includes: The Provisioning Module, which includes all the functionality of the Management Module, provides the ability to manage kickstarts, manage and deploy configuration files, create snapshots of your systems over time and roll your systems back to those snapshots, and <a href='http://www.redhat.com/rhn/rhndetails/provisioning/' target='_blank'>more</a>.
The customer's indivdual systems connect: The customer's indivdual systems connect with RHN via the internet and exchange packages and information with the central RHN servers.
The customer's individual systems connec: The customer's individual systems connect to a locally hosted (on the customer network) @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Proxy. The Proxy aggregates all necessary data and performs some tasks locally, and also communicates via the internet with the central @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ servers. All information stored in the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ database is kept on the @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ servers.
All @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ functionality (syst: All @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ functionality (system profiles, reporting data, application server, etc.) is stored locally on the customers network. The @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ Server connects with @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ over the internet only to download updates (other update methods are available). This model provides customers with the ability to take their @@PRODUCT_NAME@@ solution off the public internet if desired, and also allows for greater optimization and control of your systems.

Select the channel you wish to clone fro: Select the channel you wish to clone from the list below. You can clone a channel in one of three ways:
Current state of the channel (all errata: Current state of the channel (all errata)
The new channel will include all of the: The new channel will include all of the latest packages from the target channel, and all errata related to the channel will be cloned into your organization. If your organization already owns a clone of an erratum, the new channel will be associated with that erratum instead of creating another clone of the erratum.
Original state of the channel (no errata: Original state of the channel (no errata)
The new channel will be a clone of the o: The new channel will be a clone of the original state of the target channel. This is done by cloning all of the packages from the target channel which do not have an erratum associated with them. No errata will be cloned into your organization.
The original state of the target channel: The original state of the target channel will be cloned into the new channel. You will then have the option to select the errata you wish to import into the new channel. Importing an erratum will bring the packages from the target channel referred to by the erratum into the new channel. Selecting all of the errata from the list of potential errata is the same as cloning the current state of the channel. Selecting none of the errata is the same as cloning the original state of the channel.
